sense.name: an official diplomat representing a government
sense.commentary: ENVOY[+person][+diplomat][+official][+government] [+relation][+role][+representative][+formal] [+quality][+rank][+official][+diplomatic] Note: an envoy is ranked lower than an ambassador
sense.examples: Her father was an envoy to England before he became ambassador to France. The foreign minister is meeting with several ambassadors and envoys this afternoon.

sense.name: any messenger on a mission to represent another
sense.commentary: ENVOY[+person][+messenger][+deployed][+mission] [+relation][+role][+representative][+impromptu] Note: often implies a one-time mission, unlike the permanent job of Sense 1
sense.examples: Mary volunteered to be the envoy of the dog owners at the next town meeting. The manager sent some of his staff as envoys to the client to try to smooth over some misunderstandings about the project.

sense.name: a brief concluding stanza of certain poetic forms
sense.examples: His poems usually end in an envoy that is a rhymed couplet.
